channel.title: Sermon Videos on First Baptist Church Muncie
channel.description: Recent content in Sermon Videos on First Baptist Church Muncie

item.title: Well Seasoned
item.description: In Matthew 5:13-16, Jesus challenges His followers to be salt and light.

item.title: Sermon on the Mount
item.description: Jesus gathers his disciples on a mountainside to teach them about true happiness.

item.title: Leave Your Nets
item.description: In Matthew 4:12-23 Jesus leaves his hometown to begin his ministry.

item.title: The Supremacy of Christ
item.description: Caleb Rolling is a student at Taylor University.

item.title: A Lesson in Humility
item.description: John the Baptist was deemed the greatest man every born by Jesus.

item.title: Way of the Wise Men
item.description: On this first Sunday of Epiphany, we consider the journey of the wise men.

item.title: Gratitude
item.description: As we gather in a combined service, Troy Hershman will be preaching from Luke 17:11-19 on this last Sunday of the decade.

item.title: Urbanized Eden
item.description: As John encounters God’s new heaven and earth, he describes a reality with no evil, no death.

item.title: All Things New
item.description: As we anticipate God’s coming in the season of Advent, we continue to work our way through Revelation.

item.title: Final Judgment
item.description: As we come to Revelation 20, we witness a chained up dragon who will be released for one final act.

item.title: Victory over Evil
item.description: As we begin the season of Advent, we long for Jesus to show up and make all things right.

item.title: Babylon Fallen
item.description: In Revelation 18, a mighty angel declares the fall of Babylon.

item.title: The Prostitute and the Monster
item.description: John is carried way by one of the seven angels.

item.title: Seven Plagues
item.description: In Revelation 16, the seven bowls which are held by the seven angels are poured out.

item.title: Sincere Worship
item.description: Revelation 15 is an interlude in the drama.

item.title: Endurance
item.description: As we come to Revelation 14, we are reminded of the destiny of the dragon, his beasts and his followers.

item.title: Two Monsters
item.description: In Revelation 13, two monsters appear.

item.title: The Woman and the Dragon
item.description: Revelation 12 describes heavenly realities with new images.

item.title: Two Witnesses
item.description: In Revelation 11, we encounter a strange story of two witnesses who are killed, bodies exposed and then raised to life.

item.title: Time Ending
item.description: John returns to earth in Revelation 10, but his vision continues.

item.title: Evil Is Ugly
item.description: As we come to Revelation 9, we are reminded of the destructive nature of evil.

item.title: Pruning the Tree
item.description: As the seventh seal is broken, a dramatic silence comes over heaven.

item.title: The Great Rescue
item.description: Six seals have been opened. As we await the seventh seal, we are held in suspense.

item.title: Opening the Seals
item.description: As the seals are opened, we might be surprised.

item.title: The Lamb
item.description: As John is standing in the throne room, he sees a scroll.

item.title: The Throne Room
item.description: The Christians in the first century were living in a world that seemed out of control.

item.title: Letters: Part 2
item.description: In Revelation 3, Jesus addresses the strengths and the failings of three (of the seven) churches in Asia minor.

item.title: Letters: Part 1
item.description: In Revelation 2, Jesus addresses the strengths and the failings of four (of the seven) churches in Asia minor.

item.title: Into the Neighborhood
item.description: As we continue in a special summer emphasis around discovering all that God is doing in our neighborhood, we will highlight various ministries and programs that are in and around our church.

item.title: Jesus Revealed
item.description: Exiled on the island of Patmos, John encounters Jesus.

item.title: Introducing Revelation
item.description: In this opening sermon in a sermon series on the book of Revelation, we consider interpretive keys to this daunting book.

item.title: Jesus Teaches Us How to Pray
item.description: How do we know how to pray?

item.title: Poverty in the Bible
item.description: As we prepare for our July neighborhood canvas, we pause to consider God’s heart for the poor.

item.title: Call of the Father
item.description: On this day of celebration for dads, we reflect on Paul’s admonition for Fathers.

item.title: Pentecost
item.description: As we conclude the season of Easter, we consider what happens in Acts 2.

item.title: Ascension Sunday
item.description: On Ascension Sunday, we find the disciples witnessing lifted into heaven.

item.title: Peace
item.description: As we study the third encounter of the Risen Christ in Luke 24, we find a gathered group of faithless, fearful disciples.

item.title: Emmaus
item.description: Luke 24 records three encounters. Last week, we studied the women at the tomb.

item.title: The Original Mother
item.description: On this Mother’s Day, we turn to Genesis 2; Eve is created.

item.title: New Direction
item.description: The story of Cornelius and Peter in Acts 10 is a challenging story.

item.title: Great Commission
item.description: As Matthew closes his gospel, he highlights Jesus’ instructions to his followers.

item.title: He Has Risen
item.description: The Resurrection of Jesus is one of the most powerful events in all of history.

item.title: King of Kings
item.description: As Jesus enters the city of Jerusalem just a few days before his death, he rides a colt, clears the temple and boldly proclaims his Messiah-ship.

item.title: Hidden Talents
item.description: As we continue to study the parables of Jesus, we come to the story of the master who distributes talents to his servants and leaves town.

item.title: Lamentations
item.description: Neil Kring will be preaching from the book of Lamentations.

item.title: Generosity
item.description: The parable of the workers in the vineyard is a powerful story of the reversal of the Kingdom of God.

item.title: Follow Me
item.description: The story of the rich young man in Matthew 19 challenges our understanding of wealth.

item.title: Forgive
item.description: Peter asks Jesus an honest question.

item.title: Transfiguration
item.description: The season of Epiphany ends with the story of the Transfiguration.

item.title: Abundant Table
item.description: As we survey the feeding of the five thousand, we are reminded of how Jesus calls us to join Him.

item.title: The Parables of Jesus
item.description: Jesus often teaches his followers through parables.

item.title: Plank Eye
item.description: As Jesus instructs his followers in Kingdom living, he uses a dramatic illustration.

item.title: Hearts Follow Treasure
item.description: Jesus instructs us to be careful where we place our stockpiles, our treasures.

item.title: Stories
item.description: As we gather to discuss a new venture for our congregation, we discuss Jesus’ admonition to allow our lives, our stories to impact the world around us.

item.title: Rivers in the Desert
item.description: The first event in the ministry of Jesus takes place in the wilderness.

item.title: Quest of the Wise Men
item.description: The song Twelve Days of Christmas remind us that Christmas does not happen on one day.

item.title: Shepherds Visit
item.description: Troy Hershman will be sharing about the visit from the shepherds in Luke 2.

item.title: Emmanuel
item.description: On this Sunday before Christmas, we consider the tremendous faith of Joseph.

item.title: Light of the World
item.description: On this third Sunday of Advent, we continue to anticipate God showing up.

item.title: Esther
item.description: The season of Advent is a time of waiting, trusting, depending on God to act and move.

item.title: Why?
item.description: Habakkuk is a little known jewel in the Old Testament.

item.title: Jeremiah's Temple Sermon
item.description: The words of Jeremiah in the Temple challenge modern readers to examine their understanding of the church.

item.title: Trust God
item.description: As we come to Harvest Sunday, we express our gratitude for all that God has given to us.

item.title: Micah
item.description: The story of God has many facets.

item.title: Wash and Be Clean
item.description: The story of Naaman is one of difficult circumstances used for the ultimate glory of God.

item.title: Solomon's Wisdom
item.description: King Solomon quickly discovers the complexity of leading the people of God.

item.title: Made New
item.description: The story of David and Bathsheba would qualify for a TV mini-series or blockbuster movie.

item.title: Joshua as Faithful Servant and Triumphant Leader
item.description: Bill Eidson preached on Joshua during both services on Sunday, October 14.

item.title: The Commandments
item.description: As God continues to establish His people as a holy nation, He gives them instructions on how to live.

item.title: Rescue
item.description: God dramatically delivers his people out of the grips of Egyptian slavery.

item.title: Joseph
item.description: The story of Joseph is one of ups and downs.

item.title: Abraham
item.description: As we continue through the story of God, we find God shifting His approach in how he will rescue his creation.

item.title: Noah
item.description: As we begin working through the Narrative Lectionary, we come to the story of Noah.

item.title: The Power of the Spirit
item.description: As we conclude our series on the Holy Spirit, we discuss the crucial reliance on the power of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: Pastor Anniversary Sunday
item.description: We gathered in a combined service at 10:45 AM to celebrate the 10th Anniversary of Pastor Wade Allen and his family coming to Muncie.

item.title: Gifts of the Spirit
item.description: As we are empowered by the Holy Spirit, we are given gifts of service.

item.title: A New Work
item.description: The familiar story of Nicodemus reminds us that we must experience new birth in order to enter the Kingdom of God.

item.title: Living Water
item.description: As we continue our series on the Holy Spirit, we come to the story of the woman at the well.

item.title: Work of the Spirit
item.description: In our second week of our study on the Holy Spirit, we discuss the work/role of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: The Spirit and Jesus
item.description: As we begin a sermon series about the Holy Spirit, we examine the prominence of the Holy Spirit in the Gospels.

item.title: Centrality of Love
item.description: As we conclude our series in the first epistle of John, we find love as a central characteristic of the true God follower.

item.title: How to Recognize Truth from Error
item.description: We gathered in a combined service at 10:45 AM on this holiday weekend.

item.title: No More Pretending
item.description: John highlights the incompatible nature of light and darkness.

item.title: We Have Seen
item.description: As we begin a four week series in 1 John, we explore the opening words of this epistle.

item.title: Envy
item.description: As we conclude our study in the Ten Commandments, we are instructed to not covet.

item.title: Others
item.description: As we continue to discuss the Ten Commandments, the second table focuses on our relationships with others.

item.title: Relationship with God
item.description: As we explore the first table of the Ten Commandments, we discover that we serve a God who loves us deeply and wants an exclusive relationship with us.

item.title: First Things First
item.description: As we begin our series on the Ten Commandments, we are reminded that the Commandments are not a moral code for the world.

item.title: The Call of the Church
item.description: On Pentecost Sunday, we gather to celebrate the birth of the church.

item.title: Waiting
item.description: On Ascension Sunday, we consider the events surrounding the Ascension of Jesus.

item.title: Leaving Prayer
item.description: As Jesus prepares for his departure, he prays.

item.title: Saul
item.description: As we continue to explore Jesus’ post-resurrection appearances through the season of Easter, we come to one of the least likely appearances.

item.title: Fully Restored
item.description: Jesus’ third appearance to his disciples took place in the same region, same area where he initially invited them to follow him.

item.title: Road To Emmaus
item.description: All the events that surrounded Jesus crucifixion must have been overwhelming for his followers.

item.title: Believe
item.description: Jesus’ appearance to the disciples turns fear into joy.

item.title: Risen
item.description: It is Resurrection Sunday and we gather to celebrate the Risen Christ.

item.title: The Crucifixion
item.description: Neil Kring will be preaching on Mark 15:16-41 as we reflect on Jesus’ crucifixion.

item.title: Betrayal and Trial
item.description: As we make our way toward Easter, we walk with Jesus through his final days with his disciples.

item.title: Getting Ready
item.description: As Jesus closes out his ministry on earth and looks toward the cross, he knows that the road will not always be easy.

item.title: Mark Continued
item.description: Wilisha Scaife will be preaching on March 4.

item.title: Seeing and Following Jesus
item.description: As we come to Mark 10, we are exposed to the obstacles that keep people from following Jesus.

item.title: The Jesus Way
item.description: As we continue the story of Jesus, we find it easy to confess Him as Messiah.

item.title: Revealing Jesus
item.description: As Mark continues to relate the story of Jesus, we are beginning to see patterns.

item.title: Fear or Faith
item.description: As we continue the story of Jesus, we are faced with the question of his identity.

item.title: Hidden Things
item.description: As we explore the message of Jesus, as recorded by Mark, we find him speaking to the crowds in parables.

item.title: Who is Jesus?
item.description: Mark describes several encounters that Jesus has with the religious leaders.

item.title: Mark Continued
item.description: Jim Sandberg will be teaching over Mark 1:21-45 on this second Sunday of our Mark series.

item.title: On the Move
item.description: As we begin our series through the Gospel of Mark, the central figure of the story is introduced, Jesus.
